direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods construct a Shape with a specified number of items and bits, but fromNM calculates the number of hash functions.
Both methods construct a Shape with a specified number of items, bits, and hash functions, but fromNMK directly uses the provided hash functions.
Both methods construct a Shape with a specified probability, bits, and hash functions, but fromPMK calculates the number of items.
Both methods construct a Shape with a specified number of hash functions and bits, but fromKM does not involve item count or probability.
fromNP depends on this method to calculate the optimal number of hash functions based on the number of items and bits.
fromNP uses this method to validate the number of items before proceeding with the calculation.
fromNP uses this method to validate the probability before proceeding with the calculation.
fromNP uses this method to validate the calculated probability after constructing the Shape.
fromNP uses this method to calculate the probability of false positives after constructing the Shape.
Both methods involve calculations related to the number of bits, which is used in determining the number of bit maps.
